sub_title: Senior Technical Product Manager at Booking.com
summary:
I currently spend my time managing core infrastructure products, servicing cross vertical transactional capabilities at Booking.com, more specifically reservations. My main focussing is on increasing reliability, efficiency and robustness, and working towards our company objectives. 

Booking.com is an online travel agency, originally focussing on accommodation. However, the business has grown tremendously, and is now focussing on enabling a connected trip for customers, where flights, cars, accommodation, attractions etc. all form part of the product offering and potentially a single reservation.

My focus is people, product and process. 

I love being involved in the career growth of the people around me, ensuring they have all the training, skills and EQ required to continually excel.

We work in a very agile fashion, where data drives decisions and change comes naturally.

I have been working in the Software Development space many years. Programming was my first passion!

Soon however, I realized that there is so much more than just code. I delved more and more into software design and architecture, before stumbling into the cauldrons of technology management.

I am quite philosophical about software and the use thereof. I like to apply proven practices to the management of projects and programs, where and if applicable.

Definitely theory Y. Love innovation. 

On my plate:
 - Product manager - infrastructure, Booking.com

On my side plate
 - Recently relocated to the Netherlands, so getting used to winter
 - Trying to continue my PhD


Contact me at: justinbredenkamp@gmail.com

awards.title: Achievement Award
awards.description: This Achivement Award was given in recognition of outstanding work and achievement.

projects.title: Digital Transformation
projects.description:
The project is aimed at a re-engineering of the current corporate website on to Sitecore (previously SharePoint) as well as the redesign of the pages/web structure based on a client-centric approach.

The UX is based on customer and stakeholder insights, desk research and competitor research.
The ultimate outcome is to ensure personalised content for visitors as well as clear analytics that can indicate the journey from visitor to client.
The goal for marketing is to prove that the digital channels are revenue generating and to determine the extent thereof.

projects.title: TicketPros
projects.description:
TicketPros is an online ticketing solution currently selling tickets for various sporting codes and other events. Clients include Cricket SA, Blue Bulls Company, Western Province Rugby and many more.
Even organisers can configure their own events through a back end portal which then reflects on the client facing website.
Various sales channels are available, allowing for ticket delivery/printing wherever convenient.

projects.title: AA Rescue
projects.description:
The Automobile Association of South Africa required a convenient way to add value to their customer base.

We developed an Android, BlackBerry and IOS Rescue application which notifies the AA when the user activates the Panic button. This prompts the AA to assist the user promptly.

A website was also created to allow users to create their profile, add vehicles, contacts and medical details. These details are sent to the AA to keep their data up to date.

contributors.headline: Senior Technical Product Manager at Booking.com
Head of Technology, Domestic Retail & Digital at Bupa

projects.title: Blu Agent
projects.description:
Blu Agent is a white-labeled version of mobiMerchant.

It is a USSD solution, allowing agents to sell airtime and Rica SIM cards for their own clients. They in turn earn a commission on these transactions.
The partner can then distribute funds to their agents as well as draw reports using a web portal.

contributors.headline: Senior Technical Product Manager at Booking.com

projects.title: Blue Bulls Club
projects.description:
The Vodacom Blue Bulls Supporters’ Club is the official supporters’ club of Pretoria’s favourite rugby team. It is a club that rewards you for being a Blue Bulls supporter. You will earn points for interacting with the Blue Bulls, attending matches and so much more. You will also have the opportunity to burn these points on exclusive VIP experiences, merchandise and even match tickets.

The solution exists out of the following components:
- Website front end
- Business layer
- Loyalty component
- Debit raising component
- Tablet solution
- NFC integration

projects.title: Senda
projects.description:
Sell airtime and electricity to your friends and family. Senda puts the power in your hands by letting you sell airtime and electricity to your friends and family. Recharge their account and you make money!
Registration is easy and after a minimum of R100 deposit you can
start selling Vodacom, MTN and Cell C airtime. Telkom, Neotel,
Bela Prepaid phone credit. Electricity vouchers are also available.
Senda allows you to make money selling airtime from your cellphone.

Senda allows users to generate income by selling Vodacom, MTN and Cell C airtime and Telkom, Neotel and Bela prepaid phone credit, as well as electricity vouchers, from their cellphones.A minimum R100 deposit is all that is required to start the simple registration process.

Dial *130*256# to register or visit www.senda.co.za for more information

projects.title: Rand Water Mobile Meter Reading Solution
projects.description:
Enabled Rand Water agents to manage job cards and upload job details to the cloud using iMate smart phones.


Here's a letter from William Mzimba, director at Accenture:
"
Thursday the 10th February 2004, marked a significant milestone for the Resources OG in South Africa, with the Go-Live of our first Mobile Computing solution at Rand Water.  The project aimed at replacing the existing Husky Meter Reading Solution with a Mobile Computing Meter Reading Solution. The new Mobile Meter Reading Solution utilises leading edge Technology such as i-Mate Devices (combination between PDA and Cellphone) and the GPRS Network as provided by Vodacom.



The significance of this solution is that it provides Business Solutions on a PDA screen size device. Accenture developed this asset based on similar Field Force Enablement (FFE) solutions developed for Tablet PC's in the UK and U.S.A.



This solution leads Rand Water into the new era of Mobile Technology and will result in significant bottom line savings for the company.  We are looking at packaging this solution to on-sell to other utilities in Southern Africa.



I would like to congratulate the following team for their extraordinary effort:

Schalk Kock;

Jan Louw;

Kalpana Ramjee;

Melody Taylor;

Justin Breedenkamp; and

David Spencer."





Kind Regards



William Mzimba
Director
Accenture South Africa
"

projects.title: Sun International Casino Management Solution
projects.description:
A rewrite of Sun International's Casino Management Software.

Client Description: Sun International's operations include resorts, luxury hotel products, and casinos in 14 jurisdictions in South Africa, Zambia, Botswana, Namibia, Lesotho and Swaziland. As at June 2007 revenue stood at R6937 million, up by 17% from 2006, and profit before taxation at R1 691 million. 
 URL: [http://www.suninternational.co.za] Industry: Hospitality and Lesuire
 Project: Casino Management System Redevelopment
 Project Description: Reanalysis and redevelopment of Sun Internationalâ€™s Casino Management

System. (40 person team) 
 Technologies Used :- 
 Programming Language: C, C++, C# 
 Application Server: .NET 
 Database: MS SQL 
 Hardware: Intel (Dell) 
 Operating System: Windows 2003 
 Other: GDM (Casino Device Controller), Micros Point-of-Sale, Smartcards
 Project Outcomes: This project was eventually cancelled due to commercial reasons.

Director at iVeri Payment Technology

profile_positions.description:
I'm working on providing more value to the booker by bundling add-ons to their stay at a preferred rate. Partners have additional services and offerings that they would like to provide to the customers, and I intend to make that happen.

Before this I spent my time managing horizontal business services, servicing cross vertical transactional capabilities at Booking.com, more specifically reservations. 

My main focus was on increasing reliability, efficiency and robustness, and working towards our company objectives.
profile_positions.title: Senior Product Manager

profile_positions.description:
Derivco is a subsidiary of Microgaming, the leading online gaming platform and content provider world wide. Products include sportsbook, casino, bingo, live dealer, multiplayer, poker, blackjack as well as platform solutions to enable operators.

We support the product base throughout the globe, with extensive load and usage. We handle hundreds of thousands of bets per minute seamlessly, from around the world, enabled by our robust solutions.

I am responsible for managing a team of cross functional individuals, as well as a set of products. 

We aim to keep our products compliant in current markets, and also deliver products into new markets.

My focus in product, process and person. This means I need to safeguard our architecture and product base, ensure my team delivers product at the right level of quality and in time, and I grow my team to be the best they can be.
Personally my priority is my team. I believe if they excel, the product will too.
profile_positions.title: Product Owner - Markets delivery

profile_positions.description:
I am responsible for the H5 Container team in Pretoria, working closely with the teams in Durban.

We innovate and maintain a client side javascript framework, used by the game development houses.
profile_positions.title: Product owner: H5 Container

profile_positions.description:
Dimension Data operates across 58 countries in 5 regions, boasting with clients included in 72% of the Fortune Global 100 and 60% of the Fortune Global 500​​​​​​.

Services and products offered include digital infrastructure, hybrid cloud solutions, cyber security and work spaces for tomorrow.

I assist with the project management activities for all www.dimensiondata.com initiatives, including fringe digital activities.

Currently we are busy transforming our digital marketing initiatives, focusing on a client centric design and implementing a Sitecore platform, which is included in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for WCM. This will enable us to drive users down a personalized journey on the website and allow us to link website visitors to actual sales.

The Tour de France is a key opportunity for Dimension Data, and I assist with all digital efforts for it.
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Manager - Online Systems

profile_positions.description:
TicketPros sells sporting event tickets online to the public, leveraging off close relationships to the clients who's events are hosted.

The business was bought by the Blue Label Telecoms group and Blue Label One was tasked to oversee the technical team, which is where I was introduced to the company.

I currently oversee the technical growth of the company as well as align the technical strategies with the business goals. My team consists of 5 dedicated members who eat, sleep and breath ticketing.

The solution consists of a public facing website for ticket purchases and a back-office site used by ticket administrators to set up events and manage ticket sales.
profile_positions.title: Head of Technology

profile_positions.description:
I met up with Bryan Orsmond and Adriano Iorio at Blue Label Telecoms head office and they soon convinced me to take up a position at Blue Label One as a Scrum Manager.

It was soon apparent that they are passionate and philosophical about software as I am.

I currently oversee our sprints and delivery plans, as well as project planning for our clients.

We have numerous internal products in the operations sphere, as well as some projects for external clients.

My main goal is to own our SDLC, continually improve the way we do things and base our attempts on solid known practices and facts. I want to minimize repeat mistakes and maximize team performance and enjoyment. We encourage communication between team members, where the best reasoning wins and where everyone learns from each other.

Ultimately, Blue Label One should be the employment option of choice for the best technical people in the country!
profile_positions.title: Project / Scrum Manager

profile_positions.description:
My interest in systems architecture was growing at a fast pace at Intenda. The vacancy for a systems architect arose at Altech Netstar and after meeting Eugene Terblanche for an interview I couldn't resist.

Altech Netstar have unique problems which require unique solutions. Vehicle tracking results in millions of location based transactions flooding into the systems, as well as heavy reporting requirements outgoing.

I was introduced to GSM products and got involved in the design of a SIM management solution. This would allow the business to receive, provision and assign SIM cards for different uses to different places. Tracking of these SIM's are of great importance to ensure auditability of the costs as well as proper functional compliance of the units in the field.

Altech Netstar sent me on a post-grad course at the University of Stellenbosch's Industrial Engineering faculty, covering Systems Architecture, Program Management and Systems Engineering. Of all the items the Project Management course created the most excitement.

I followed that up with a PMBok course which was an eye opener!

The opportunity was presented to become a project manager on a project to rewrite Altech Netstar's fleet management solution. The current solution had become outdated in terms of functionality as well as technology.
It was a long term project and I unfortunately never saw the closure of it.

It was here that I realised I love the interaction between the development team, the client and the business. I enjoy being involved in and managing the whole SDLC.
profile_positions.title: Systems Architect

profile_positions.description:
Intenda employed me as a Developer to assist with a new framework spearheaded by Wayne Wrigley, called Devolution.

Devolution is a framework; the backbone of a set of configurable web modules offered to clients. The framework allows rapid web application development by relying on configurable scripts that house the business logic and user experience in a data store.
Consultants can assist clients to quickly integrate their requirements into an industry standard solution.

This is where I had my first taste of leadership. I was the lead developer on the solution and also assisted with recruitment.

I paid more attention to proper patterns and practices, architecture and designs. I realized the power of UML and tried to implement design principles as much as possible. I was promoted to the position of an Analyst Developer and also earned an Achievement Award for efforts on the Devolution project.

Dabbling in a bit of personal project management introduced some interest in time management and scheduling which would later spark more interest.
profile_positions.title: Analyst Developer

profile_positions.description:
Accenture lives up to its reputation. Big clients and big projects!

I joined the ATS (Accenture Technology Services) team under Marc de Kock. This is where I had my first taste of Agile development and real high performance development. Marc ran a clean shop where every developer knew what was assigned to him her, with everyone's tasks culminating into the end solution seamlessly.

My first project was the rewrite of the Sun International Casino Management Solution. There were many architects, more testers and even more developers. We even had some old guys looking at the old C code to relate the requirements to us!
The solution was a ASP.Net web application connecting to different tiers and connectors (to casino devices).

However, my favourite projects were two mobile solutions. 

The first was a meter reading solution for Eskom (sole developer), whereby the field agents used my app running on iMate smartphones to take electricity box meter readings and and synchronise their job sheets with a service I deployed in the cloud.

The second mobile solution was very similar. Rand Water agents had to take water meter readings and also turn off/on water supply where necessary. Again I implemented a service in the cloud along with iMates in the field.

Both solutions were running on Windows Mobile, which back then was bleeding edge. I was on the phone to Microsoft developers in Germany daily to discuss issues/solutions of the framework.
Just using the GPRS connection was seriously tough.
profile_positions.title: Developer

profile_positions.description:
At Ke Concepts I filled the role of a developer. Servicing the Micro Lending business gave me more experience in high transactional systems.
My manager, Gareth Jane, was instrumental in introducing me to Microsoft technologies through MS Tech days and knowledge sharing sessions (which also included great muffins!).

The development process was also a lot faster than I was used to, where the client's needs were of utmost importance and always catered for.
profile_positions.title: Developer

profile_positions.description:
Whilst busy with my final year at the University of Stellenbosch, I managed to secure an interview at Iveri.
I flew over for an interview and managed to secure a great junior developer position.

Under the watchful eye of my manager, Roland Elferink, and the other senior developers I managed to grasp at skills not tought by universities!

I was on a quick learning diet of VB 6, .Net, transactional databases and report development.

My claim to fame was the rewrite of the ACSA parking station software, which allows you to pay for your airport parking with your credit card. The parking machine would send your credit card details and parking cost to the server, which will process the transaction through Nedbank. I leveraged on VB 6 for the main chunk of the solution.
profile_positions.title: Developer
